Delicious tapas - great staff.  This place was recommended to us and it was great.  We went for lunch and although it's very small got lucky with a table for two.  The staff was helpful and walked us through some menu questions as it's not in english - not an issue at all.  You can order tapas at the bar with some cava or sit at a table.  Very busy with locals and tourists as it's located on the same block as the Picasso Museum.  Every dish was better than the last - fried pork, sausage plate with chickpeas, grilled octopus, anchovies in vinegar - all amazing.
